result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges for work

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.

- Absolute sobriety with random testing.
- Write a 2 page essay as to fatal and non-fatal shootings.
COURT GRANTS EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaliyah Diana Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Aaliyah Diana Anderson.  Attorney Tom Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduled jury trial.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
*
As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed. and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for word with credit for 1 day time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- no possession of firearms
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- write a 2 page essay as to fatal and non-fatal shootings
- 15 hours of community service

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given 
*
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 37 on 08/24/2022 at 9:00 a.m.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.

Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaliyah Diana Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaliyah Diana Anderson
Current: 2743 N 11th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 03-02-2022)
Prior: 9205 West Birch Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Aaliyah Diana Anderson not in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 2:30p
